     Alternatively, no American living room is complete without a musket hanging above the mantle, and the Kentucky Long Rifle is a gorgeous piece to take that place. It doesn't get much more American than the Long Rifle.


     Rifled musket, uses standard small arms black powder, and .490 caliber lead balls for shot. Accepts #11 percussion caps.

Keep in mind that this rifle requires 'patched balls', that is to say, the bullet needs to be nestled snugly in a small piece of fabric so it stays still. The easiest test for this is simply turn your rifle muzzle-down.  If all the shot and powder runs out, it was incorrectly loaded(keep in mind incorrect loads will still fire fine, just keep that muzzle pointed up until you shoot). A correct load in a Long Rifle will not shift, unless you start whacking your rifle against things, and then you have a whole different set of problems.
